snippet: Job numbers are stronger than expected, but many jobs still do not pay enough for workers to make a decent living.
abstract: Editorial, while welcoming strong November employment report, warns job creation remains concentrated in low-income work that does not pay enough for employees to make decent living; calls on Congress to prevent expiration of federal jobless benefits for the long-term unemployed as country awaits raise in federal minimum wage.
lead_paragraph: Job numbers are stronger than expected, but many jobs still do not pay enough for workers to make a decent living.
